Create MIPS catalogue from posterior

Parameters:
  • posterior – MIPS xidplus.posterior class
  • prior24 – MIPS xidplus.prior class
  • Bayes_P24 – Bayes Pvalue residual statistic for MIPS 24
Returns:

fits hdulist

xidplus.catalogue.create_SPIRE_cat(posterior, prior250, prior350, prior500)[source]¶

Create SPIRE catalogue from posterior

Parameters:
  • posterior – SPIRE xidplus.posterior class
  • prior250 – SPIRE 250 xidplus.prior class
  • prior350 – SPIRE 350 xidplus.prior class
  • prior500 – SPIRE 500 xidplus.prior class
  • Bayes_P250 – Bayes Pvalue residual statistic for SPIRE 250
  • Bayes_P350 – Bayes Pvalue residual statistic for SPIRE 350
  • Bayes_P500 – Bayes Pvalue residual statistic for SPIRE 500
Returns:

fits hdulist

xidplus.io module¶

class xidplus.io.MacOSFile(f)[source]¶

Bases: object

read(n)[source]¶
write(buffer)[source]¶
xidplus.io.git_version()[source]¶

Returns the git version of the module This function returns a string composed of the abbreviated Git hash of the module source, followed by the date of the last commit. If the source has some local modifications, “ [with local modifications]” is added to the string. This is used to print the exact version of the source code that was used inside a Jupiter notebook.

xidplus.io.load(filename)[source]¶
Parameters:filename – filename of xidplus data to load
Returns:list of prior classes and posterior class

Save xidplus priors and posterior data

Parameters:
  • priors – list of prior classes
  • posterior – posterior class
  • filename – filename to save to

xidplus.moc_routines.get_HEALPix_pixels(order, ra, dec, unique=True)[source]¶

Work out what HEALPix a source is in

Parameters:
  • order – order of HEALPix
  • ra – Right Ascension
  • dec – Declination
  • unique – if unique is true, removes duplicate pixels
Returns:

list of HEALPix pixels :rtype:
xidplus.moc_routines.get_fitting_region(order, pixel)[source]¶

Expand tile by quarter of a pixel for fitting

Parameters:
  • order – the HEALPix resolution level
  • pixel – given HEALPix pixel that needs to be fit
Returns:

HEALPix pixels that need to be fit
xidplus.moc_routines.sources_in_tile(pixel, order, ra, dec)[source]¶

Check which sources are in HEALPix pixel

Parameters:
  • pixel – HEALPix pixel
  • order – order of HEALPix pixel
  • ra – Right Ascension
  • dec – Declination
Returns:

boolean array expressing whether in MOC or not :rtype:boolean array
xidplus.moc_routines.tile_in_tile(order_small, tile_small, order_large)[source]¶
Routine to find our what larger tile to load data from when fitting smaller tiles.
Returns larger tile no. Useful for when fitting segmented maps on HPC using a hierarchical segmentation scheme
Parameters:
  • order_small – order of smaller tile
  • tile_small – tile no. of smaller tile
  • order_large – order of larger tiling scheme
Returns:

pixel number of larger tile

xidplus.posterior module¶

class xidplus.posterior.posterior_stan(fit, priors, scale=True)[source]¶

Bases: object

scale_posterior(priors)[source]¶

Stan searches over range 0-1 and scales parameters with flux limits. This function scales those parameters to flux values

Parameters:priors – list of prior classes used in fit

  • posterior – xidplus.posterior class
  • nrep – number of replicated maps

xidplus.posterior_maps.ymod_map(prior, flux)[source]¶

Create replicated model map (no noise or background) i.e. A*f

Parameters:
  • prior – xidplus.prior class
  • flux – flux vector
Returns:

map array, in same format as prior.sim

xidplus.prior module¶

class xidplus.prior.prior(im, nim, imphdu, imhdu, moc=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

cut_down_cat()[source]¶

Cuts down prior class variables associated with the catalogue data to the MOC assigned to the prior class: self.moc

cut_down_map()[source]¶

Cuts down prior class variables associated with the map data to the MOC assigned to the prior class: self.moc

cut_down_prior()[source]¶

Cuts down prior class variables to the MOC assigned to the prior class

get_pointing_matrix(bkg=True)[source]¶

Calculate pointing matrix. If bkg = True, bkg is fitted to all pixels. If False, bkg only fitted to where prior sources contribute

get_pointing_matrix_coo()[source]¶

Get scipy coo version of pointing matrix. Useful for sparse matrix multiplication

get_pointing_matrix_unknown_psf(bkg=True)[source]¶

Calculate pointing matrix for unknown psf. If bkg = True, bkg is fitted to all pixels. If False, bkg only fitted to where prior sources contribute

prior_bkg(mu, sigma)[source]¶

Add background prior. Assumes \(B \sim \mathcal{N}(\mu,\sigma^2)\)

Parameters:
  • mu – mean
  • sigma – standard deviation
prior_cat(ra, dec, prior_cat_file, flux_lower=None, flux_upper=None, ID=None, moc=None, z_median=None, z_sig=None)[source]¶

Input info for prior catalogue

Parameters:
  • ra – Right ascension (JD2000) of sources
  • dec – Declination (JD2000) of sources
  • prior_cat_file – filename of catalogue
  • flux_lower – lower limit of flux for each source
  • flux_upper – upper limit of flux for each source
  • ID – HELP_ID for each source
  • moc – Multi-Order Coverage map
  • z_median – median of redshift pdf
  • z_sig – sigma of redshift pdf
prior_cat_stack(ra, dec, prior_cat, flux_lower=None, flux_upper=None, ID=None)[source]¶

Input info for prior catalogue of sources being stacked

Parameters:
  • ra – Right ascension (JD2000) of sources
  • dec – Declination (JD2000) of sources
  • prior_cat – filename of catalogue
  • ID – HELP_ID for each source
set_prf(prf, pindx, pindy)[source]¶

Add prf array and corresponding x and y scales (in terms of pixels in map)

Parameters:
  • prf – n x n array, where n is an odd number, and the centre of the prf is at the centre of the array
  • pindx – n array, pixel scale of prf array
  • pindy – n array, pixel scale of prf array
set_tile(moc)[source]¶

Update prior with new MOC and update appropriate variables :param moc: Multi-order Coverage map from pymoc

upper_lim_map()[source]¶

Update flux upper limit to abs(bkg)+2*sigma_bkg+max(D) where max(D) is maximum value of pixels the source contributes to
